definition.S: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2) is a web service that provides resizable compute capacity in the cloud, allowing users to run applications on virtual machines.
Amazon CloudWatch is a monitoring and observability service that provides data and actionable insights to monitor cloud resources and applications.
Amazon CloudFront is a content delivery network (CDN) service that delivers data, videos, applications, and APIs securely and with low latency.
AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) allows you to manage access to AWS services and resources securely by creating and controlling AWS users and groups.
Amazon RDS is a managed relational database service that simplifies the process of setting up, operating, and scaling a relational database in the cloud.
Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) enables you to launch AWS resources into a virtual network that you define, isolated from other virtual networks in AWS.
Amazon Route 53 is a scalable Domain Name System (DNS) web service designed to route end-user requests to endpoints in a globally distributed manner.
AWS Elastic Beanstalk is a Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS) offering that makes it easy to deploy and manage applications in the cloud without managing infrastructure.
Amazon DynamoDB is a fully managed NoSQL database service that provides fast and predictable performance with seamless scalability.
Amazon S3 is a scalable object storage service that allows you to store and retrieve any amount of data, at any time, from anywhere on the web.
AWS Lambda is a serverless compute service that automatically runs your code in response to events, and automatically manages the compute resources for you.
Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (EKS) is a managed service that makes it easy to run Kubernetes on AWS without needing to install and operate your own Kubernetes control plane.
AWS CodePipeline is a fully managed continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) service for automating the build, test, and deploy phases of your release pipeline.
AWS Step Functions is a serverless orchestration service that lets you coordinate multiple AWS services into serverless workflows, making it easy to build and update applications.
AWS CloudFormation is a service that helps you model and set up your Amazon Web Services resources so that they can be provisioned and managed in an automated and predictable manner.
Amazon Fargate is a serverless compute engine for containers that works with Amazon ECS and EKS, letting you run containers without managing servers.
Cloud service consumption refers to how customers use and pay for cloud services, typically on a pay-as-you-go or subscription basis.
A Cloud Service Level Agreement (SLA) outlines the expected performance and availability levels for a cloud service, often including penalties for unmet targets.
Cloud integration involves connecting cloud-based services with existing on-premises infrastructure, data systems, or other cloud applications to enable seamless data flow.
Cloud-based monitoring refers to tools and services that track the performance, availability, and health of cloud-based applications and infrastructure.
Cloud federation enables multiple cloud platforms to work together, allowing applications and resources to be shared seamlessly between different providers or environments.
Cloud networking involves creating and managing network infrastructure in the cloud, including virtual private clouds (VPCs), IP addressing, and connectivity between cloud resources.
Cloud resource management involves organizing, allocating, and optimizing the use of cloud resources to ensure efficiency and cost-effectiveness.

Cloud Security Posture Management (CSPM) refers to tools and processes used to assess and improve the security of cloud environments by ensuring configurations and policies are compliant with industry standards.
Cloud DevOps refers to the combination of cloud computing and DevOps practices to automate the software development lifecycle and improve collaboration between development and operations teams.
